Good Comments: Not as undertranslated as previous seasons. Still unreadable styling, but at least it's softsubbed. Good A/V quality compared to previous Hell Girls releases.
Bad Comments: Great quality subs, and, as are their ones of season 1 and 2, are the best out there. However, speed is an issue.
Sometimes too literal, unnatural sounding and unfitting sentences.

Good Comments: Good subbing overall, though sometimes a bit to literal, subtitle colors sometimes blended with backgrounds. Refused to change spellings of certain place names, even when the show's graphics presented the correct spellings.
Perfect quality and great subs, with appropriate font. ^_^
they were consistantly good and consistantly available with alot of seeds
It's pretty difficult to get characters' names wrong, yet they somehow managed to do it multiple times and refuse to fix it.
Good but name spellings got on my nerves.
Two of the best sub groups combined; can't get much better than this. Although they could have done better with the names.
Awesome subs! Doki's release is WIN, by the way... ;)
Not many grammatical mistakes and great typesetting
Overall good translation. HOWEVER, is boring and doesn't flow as well. Try Froth Bite hardcoded subs. Rather have fun subs than all accurate.
Bad Comments: Great A/V quality at decent filesize, and seemingly good sub work.
YES.
Excellent subs, name spelling mistakes can easily be overlooked.
ass
Good grammar, spelling, translation.
good, reliable subs. no glitches.
good, easy to read subs
just gotta love their work, two really good groups joined together can't be bad, and it isn't!
did da nice job
The subs themselves are good and easy to read. The name errors annoy me, but honestly I wouldn't have known they were wrong had I not looked at the character list here on MAL.
SS nothing more to say
I like the style of the subs.
Good, unique translation.

Subbed Projects.Show Name: Zero no Tsukaima: Futatsuki no Kishi

Good Comments: The translation seems correct, but I'm not sure about stylistics (and spellings of some characters' names). A/V quality is near perfect.
Same as the first season... Perfect quality and great subs, with appropriate font but this time in HD. ^_^
Bad Comments: Continued to use wrong name spellings despite official evidence to the contrary. Used an over-styled pink font that "fit" the anime by blending into the background and being unreadable half the time.
Watched the 1st season with their fansub, and overall it's very nice quality!
Good subs. Murdered the encode though.
Good HD and subbing
Stuck with the incorrect names they used in the first season.  I thought being accurate was the goal of fansubs...
The best subs but i also agree that not following the video evidence gets annoying.
Many translation mistakes... good quality though.
Quality subtitles.
